body:
@bcmills my comment was more about how the current proposal would not help with Context.

But indeed, starting with thinking of aliasing at the package level would be better.

(Not a fan of too many build constraints though.)

re. the last line, the issue with refactoring is, to some extent, quite similar to the problem of lock free concurrent update of a tree structure where the nodes are packages and the edges are the import paths.
Clients of a package, unless themselves refactored, should not see any change (especially if we are to keep the package as the unit of compilation).
It may be done differently in Java or Pascal... but then again... I'd rather Go be different.
